title: Biased Design
question_text:
The Director of Activities at a local museum is introducing a new film series detailing the events of the assassination of John F. Kennedy, Jr. To see if there is local interest, the Director mails a survey to a random sample of $100$ residents who live in the cities near the museum.
Seventy-five responses are received and $70$% of the responses express much interest in the new film series. These results encourage the Director of Activities to launch a large advertising campaign for the new film series boasting strong local support.
Bias is present in the design of this study. Which of the following best describes the bias?

choices.text: Residents vary a lot in their opinions about the assassination of John F. Kennedy, Jr.
The percent of residents that responded was too small.
The sample of local residents was too small.
Residents who responded to this survey might generally have opinions that differ from those who did not respond.

The sample of
100
residents could, by chance, have included many people who are interested in the assassination of John F. Kennedy, Jr.
